intro: Roucheria latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf roucheria, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and specialized nurseries.
